resource.chars:
Electric Quantity 

(68) Let e represent the quantity of free positive electricity 
contained in unit of volume at any part of the field, then 
since this arises from the electrification of the different parts 
of the field not neutralizing each other we may write the 

Equation of Free Electricity 

e + df/dx + dg/dy + dh/dz = 0 (G) 

(69) If the medium conducts electricity then we shall have 
another condition which may be called as in hydrodynamics the 

Equation of Continuity 

de/dt + dp/dx + dq/dy + dr/dz = 0 (H)
